Line 42: Line 42:
The Zonbu OS is a customized version of [[Linux]] based on the [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo distribution]] using the [[Xfce]] desktop environment. It is geared towards non-technical users, and the [[user interface]] focuses more on simplicity than advanced features.
The Zonbu OS is a customized version of [[Linux]] based on the [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo distribution]] using the [[Xfce]] desktop environment. It is geared towards non-technical users, and the [[user interface]] focuses more on simplicity than advanced features.
â
The filesystem architecture combines a [[UnionFS|transparent overlay filesystem]] (pioneered by Linux [[LiveDistro|Live Distributions]]) with an [[Remote backup service|on-line backup]] service. User data is locally cached on Compact Flash Card, then transparently encrypted with [[Key size|128-bit encryption]] and transferred to remote storage servers at [[Amazon S3]].
+
The filesystem architecture combines a [[UnionFS|transparent overlay filesystem]] (pioneered by Linux [[Live Distro|Live Distributions]]) with an [[Remote backup service|on-line backup]] service. User data is locally cached on Compact Flash Card, then transparently encrypted with [[Key size|128-bit encryption]] and transferred to remote storage servers at [[Amazon S3]].
